meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sheer.
meanings.sent1: The sheerness of the fabric allowed light to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: The sheerness of the curtain made the room feel bright and airy.
meanings.sent3: The sheerness of the window was so clear that a bird almost flew into it.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty had a sheerness to it that revealed her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The sheerness of the waterfall was breathtaking, like a veil of mist.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is sheer.
meanings.sent1: The sheerness of the cliff made it dangerous to climb.
meanings.sent2: The sheerness of the fabric made it perfect for a summer dress.
meanings.sent3: The sheerness of the ice cream cone made it melt quickly in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The sheerness of the mountain revealed its rugged beauty.
meanings.sent5: The sheerness of the glass bridge was both thrilling and terrifying.

meanings.definition: The property of being transparent or translucent.
meanings.sent1: The sheerness of the glass allowed us to see the view clearly.
meanings.sent2: The sheerness of the water made it look crystal clear.
meanings.sent3: The sheerness of the jellyfish made it almost invisible in the water.
meanings.sent4: The sheerness of the plastic bag made it easy to see what was inside.
meanings.sent5: The sheerness of the air balloon gave us a bird's eye view of the landscape.
